articles.headline: With DC59 Motorhead, Dyson Looks to Create the iPad of Vacuums
articles.snippet: In a software-obsessed world, the company has invested hundreds of millions of dollars in high-tech motors as it tries to build better machines.
articles.abstract: In a software-obsessed world, the company has invested hundreds of millions of dollars in high-tech motors as it tries to build better machines.
articles.lead_paragraph: More than a decade ago, Dyson, the British company known for its line of powerful and expensive vacuum cleaners, quietly began working on an ambitious project to displace its own best invention.

articles.headline: Boys Drawn to Gaza Beach, and Into Center of Mideast Strife
articles.snippet: Two explosions struck an area that had been considered relatively safe from the intense Israeli bombing campaign.
articles.abstract: Two explosions struck an area that had been considered relatively safe from the intense Israeli bombing campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: GAZA CITY — The four Bakr boys were young cousins, the children of Gaza fishermen who had ordered them to stay indoors — and especially away from the beach. But cooped up for nine days during Israeli bombardments, the children defied their parents and went out Wednesday afternoon, the eldest shooing away his little brother, telling him it was too dangerous.

articles.headline: Raising Stakes on Russia, U.S. Adds Sanctions
articles.snippet: The new penalties, targeting a series of banks and energy and defense firms, go much further than the limits imposed so far in retaliation for Moscow’s intervention in Ukraine.
articles.abstract: The new penalties, targeting a series of banks and energy and defense firms, go much further than the limits imposed so far in retaliation for Moscow’s intervention in Ukraine.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama imposed a new round of sanctions against Russia on Wednesday, targeting some of the crown jewels of the country’s financial, energy and defense industries in what officials described as the most punishing measures taken to date by the United States in retaliation for Moscow’s intervention in Ukraine.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and James Kanter

articles.headline: In Modern Media Realm, Big Mergers Are a Bulwark Against Rivals
articles.snippet: Comcast’s bold strategy of acquisition kicked off a wave of defensive consolidation, fueled by a combination of fear and abundant capital in the media industry.
articles.abstract: Comcast’s bold strategy of acquisition kicked off a wave of defensive consolidation, fueled by a combination of fear and abundant capital in the media industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the news broke on Wednesday that 21st Century Fox, Rupert Murdoch’s huge media and entertainment company, made an $80 billion offer to buy Time Warner Inc., another big media conglomerate, it seemed like a seismic jolt in the business landscape. If the deal is ever consummated, 21st Century Fox, a public company in name only that the Murdoch family essentially controls, would oversee much of the content consumed by Americans.

articles.headline: Towns Fight to Avoid Taking In Migrant Minors
articles.snippet: Federal officials trying to house the influx of minors from Central America have been forced to scrap several proposed sites because of local opposition, as the issue grows more toxic.
articles.abstract: Federal officials trying to house the influx of minors from Central America have been forced to scrap several proposed sites because of local opposition, as the issue grows more toxic.
articles.lead_paragraph: OYSTER CREEK, Tex. — A shelter for Central American children who crossed the border illegally opened behind Gregg Griffith’s house here a few months ago. The children are quiet. No one has hopped over the fence that separates his backyard from the shelter, a once-vacant youth home. But when Mr. Griffith looks at the brightly painted brick buildings, he is mostly resentful.

articles.headline: Israeli Military Invades Gaza, With Sights Set on Hamas Operations
articles.snippet: Israel said it would target tunnels that could infiltrate its territory after cease-fire talks failed to de-escalate the air war that had raged for 10 days.
articles.abstract: Israel said it would target tunnels that could infiltrate its territory after cease-fire talks failed to de-escalate the air war that had raged for 10 days.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Israeli tanks rolled into the northern Gaza Strip on Thursday night and naval gunboats pounded targets in the south as Israel began a ground invasion after 10 days of aerial bombardment failed to stop Palestinian militants from showering Israeli cities with rockets.
articles.byline: By Jodi Rudoren and Anne Barnard

articles.headline: Microsoft to Lay Off Thousands, Most From Nokia Unit
articles.snippet: The company said about 14 percent of its work force would be eliminated, largely in the mobile phone business it acquired from Nokia.
articles.abstract: The company said about 14 percent of its work force would be eliminated, largely in the mobile phone business it acquired from Nokia.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Microsoft is trying to shake the effects of middle age.

articles.headline: At Hearing on G.M. Recall, Mary Barra Gives Little Ground
articles.snippet: As senator after senator offered more criticism of General Motors, Ms. Barra, G.M.’s chief executive, signaled that there were limits to what the company would do.
articles.abstract: As senator after senator offered more criticism of General Motors, Ms. Barra, G.M.’s chief executive, signaled that there were limits to what the company would do.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Only three months ago, Mary T. Barra arrived for the first time on Capitol Hill to apologize — publicly, profusely and personally — for General Motors’ long failure to recall millions of small cars.
articles.byline: By Bill Vlasic and Aaron M. Kessler

articles.headline: Jetliner Explodes Over Ukraine; Struck by Missile, Officials Say
articles.snippet: Malaysia Airlines 17, which was carrying 298 people onboard, was shot down by a surface-to-air missile that might have been Russian made, American officials said.
articles.abstract: Malaysia Airlines 17, which was carrying 298 people onboard, was shot down by a surface-to-air missile that might have been Russian made, American officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: GRABOVO, Ukraine — A Malaysia Airlines Boeing 777 with 298 people aboard exploded, crashed and burned on a flowered wheat field Thursday in a part of eastern Ukraine controlled by pro-Russia separatists, blown out of the sky at 33,000 feet by what Ukrainian and American officials described as a Russian-made antiaircraft missile.
articles.byline: By Sabrina Tavernise, Eric Schmitt and Rick Gladstone
